Characteristics of k-NN Classifiers (3/3)
6. The presence of irrelevant attributes can distort commonly 
used proximity measures
– Especially when the number of irrelevant attributes is large
– Hence, the presence of irrelevant and redundant attributes can adversely 
affect the performance of k-NN classifiers 
7. They can produce wrong prediction unless the appropriate 
proximity measure and data preprocessing steps are taken
– Suppose we classify people based on height and weight
• The height attribute: varies from 1.5 m to 1.85 m
• The weight attribute: varies from 40 kg to 120 kg
– Without normalization, the proximate measure may be dominated by 
weights
